data.title: Samuel Goldwyn Films Unveils Official Trailer for High
data.meta_description: Samuel Goldwyn Films has just dropped the official trailer for "Dead Money," a gripping crime thriller directed by Luc Walpoth. Scheduled for release on September 13, 2024, the film promises to deliver a high-stakes narrative... - Social News XYZ
data.text:
Samuel Goldwyn Films has just dropped the official trailer for "Dead Money," a gripping crime thriller directed by Luc Walpoth. Scheduled for release on September 13, 2024, the film promises to deliver a high-stakes narrative filled with tension, danger, and suspense.

"Dead Money" stars Emile Hirsch as Andy, a professional poker player whose life takes a dramatic turn when a violent home game robbery sets off a whirlwind of peril. Joining Hirsch is India Eisley as Chloe, his girlfriend, who becomes entangled in the chaos. The trailer teases a night where Andy must navigate the ultimate poker game, with both his and Chloe's lives hanging in the balance.

The film's storyline kicks off when a routine home poker game is abruptly interrupted by armed robbers. What follows is a night of escalating stakes as Andy is thrust into the biggest game of his life. The plot promises a high-octane blend of crime and gambling, showcasing the intense pressure of high-stakes poker against a backdrop of danger.

In addition to Hirsch and Eisley, the cast includes notable actors such as David Keith, Peter Facinelli, Jimmy Jean-Louis, Rory Culkin, and Jackie Earle Haley. With such a diverse and talented ensemble, "Dead Money" is set to offer a dynamic range of performances and add layers of complexity to the story.

The screenplay for "Dead Money" is penned by Josh Wilcox, who has crafted a narrative that intertwines the world of poker with the thrills of a crime thriller. The film is produced by Benacus Entertainment, under the leadership of Seth Michaels and Sara Sometti Michaels, in association with RNF Prods., led by Reece Foster. Their combined efforts suggest a well-supported project with a keen eye for detail and production quality.

As the release date approaches, the buzz around "Dead Money" is sure to intensify. With its blend of crime, suspense, and high-stakes poker, the film is poised to captivate audiences and deliver a memorable cinematic experience. Fans of thrillers and poker dramas should keep an eye out for this exciting new release.
